metadata.title: CVE-2014-3466 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the read_server_hello function in lib/gnutls_handshake.cin GnuTLS before 3.1.25, 3.2.x before 3.2.15, and 3.3.x before 3.3.4 allowsremote servers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possiblyexecute arbitrary code via a long session id in a ServerHello message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.0.11+really2.12.23-12ubuntu2.1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.1
libgnutls26 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.1
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

guile-gnutls - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1.1
libgnutls-xssl0 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1.1
libgnutls28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1.1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.1').
gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.1').
gnutls28 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.11-2ubuntu1.1').
